body:
# PowerChain
SmartContracts developed to establish a Distributed Grid with a light weight P2P energy market.

## Entities

### Termination
Grid Operator (DSO)

### Metering
Smart Meter Operator (Asset Owner)

### Meter
Smart Meter 

### Node
Grid Node (Customer) 

### PowerDelivery
Power Delivery Contract 

## Processes 

### Sell Power / Create Offer

In order to sell power an offer needs to be created. Offers are PowerDelivery contracts declaring:
* Feed In Node (Producer/Generator)
* Feed Out Node (Consumer/Endpoint)
* Total Power (Power in Watt-Hours to be contracted)
* Min Load (Minimum Load in Watt)
* Peak Load (Maximum Load in Watt)
* Bid Value (Ammount of "currency" to receive/spend)
* Time Start (Starting Time of delivery)
* Time End (End Time of delivery)
* Role of Owner (Feed In or Feed Out)

As soon as a power delivery contract is visible from within the blockchain one other node may counter sign this contract.

### Sign Power Delivery contract 

Nodes are able to counter sign contracts. They are able to specify a lower/higher price.

During signing a contract a test gets executed if both nodes are physically connected.
